description: The 2025 NFL season has commenced with kickoff weekend featuring major matchups, key player updates, and significant team developments. Week 1 games are underway as teams aim for strong starts and playoffs contention.
why_is_it_trending: The NFL kicked off its 2025 season with exciting games starting September 4-5, including a notable international game between the Kansas City Chiefs and the Los Angeles Chargers in São Paulo, Brazil.
Star players like De'Von Achane and Tyreek Hill of the Miami Dolphins are returning from injury, impacting team dynamics and fantasy football considerations.
The Dallas Cowboys' recent trade of star edge rusher Micah Parsons to the Green Bay Packers has sparked significant league discussion about Dallas’ season prospects.
key_points: The Lions are pursuing a third straight NFC North title, beginning their campaign against division rivals the Packers, while the Commanders hosted the Giants in Week 1 after making an NFC title game recently.

Dolphins' running back situation is critical; De'Von Achane is questionable but expected to practice, while other backs face injuries. The Patriots will miss cornerback Gonzalez against the Raiders due to a hamstring injury.
Trade deadline for all NFL player trades is November 4, 2025. Teams are adjusting rosters and strategies as they set sights on playoff contention.
overlook_what_might_happen_next: Expect increased attention on teams like the Cowboys, now without Micah Parsons, to see if offensive stars like Dak Prescott and George Pickens can carry the team to success.
Player health will remain a critical factor; teams like the Dolphins will monitor running back injuries closely, potentially affecting their offensive output.
The NFL's embrace of international games, such as the one in São Paulo, reflects efforts to globalize the league, potentially altering future scheduling and fan engagement.
